Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2009 04:37AM chemosabisis wrote: Thanks everyone for your overwhelming support.    My Onc did call me last night.  The next step will be to remove the intramammry lymph node.  Have to see a thoracic surgeon for this one, ah yes, another new doctor added to my list.  He is going to do a blood test call "cell search" it's expensive but says my insurance will cover it.  Guess it shows if there is any cancer floating around somewhere in my blood.  I was hoping that maybe my er/pr status changed, he doesn't think so but we will get the final details on that from the lymph node. My path will then be Xeloda and Tykerb. I still just numb.  Don't know how to react to this news.  I know sometime soon, I will get angry and thats what I need because I'm going to fight this with everything I have. It feels good to be back, I have missed talking to so many of you. Nicki
Posts.Title: New stage 4 here

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2009 05:26PM chemosabisis wrote: I just wanted to say thank you everyone.  You have said so many nice things and it has made me feel good.  I'm still numb and trying to get everything scheduled.  You all know how that goes.  I know I will have many questions but right now my mind is just mush. Nicki
Posts.Title: New stage 4 here

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2009 06:28AM - edited Mar 13, 2009 06:29AM by chemosabisis Diana thanks for you input.  Looks like we will be doing this together and I'm glad we will have each other to talk to.  I don't know if anyone has the answer to this question.  My Onc told me I wouldn't lose my hair on Xeloda but when I research it, I find that it does cause hair loss. I have a very good friend who set up a blog for me.  If anyone is interested its in my signature here now. I did speak with the Thoracic Surgeons nurse yesterday and I have an appointment on Tuesday, March 17th.  So things seem to be moving along.  Once again thanks for you support. Nicki  http://www.websitetoolbox.com/tool/post/nosurrenderbreastcancer/vpost?id=3360841
